sentence.Network_en: This encourages reductionist explanations of fascist ideology.
sentence.Network_cn: 这助长了对法西斯意识形态的简单化解释。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent. (in sense 2): from French idéologie, from Greek idea 'form, pattern' + -logos (denoting discourse or compilation)

entry.tran: 意识形态;思想体系;思想方式
entry.def: An ideology is a set of beliefs, especially the political beliefs on which people, parties, or countries base their actions.

means.word_mean: 1. an orientation that characterizes the thinking of a group or nation

Sentence.sentence: Since the 1980s, America has been increasingly clinging to the ideology of uncontrolled free markets and dismissing the role of government---following Ronald Regan's idea that "government is not the solution to our problem; government is the problem.
Just a few decades ago, Asia's two giants were stagnating(停滞不前) under faulty economic ideologies.

means.word_mean: 思想(体系), 思想意识

sentences.en: The ideology has great influence in the world.
sentences.cn: 这种思想体系在世界上有很大的影响。

sentences.en: There is no fundamental diversity between the two ideologies.
sentences.cn: 这两种思想意识之间并没有根本的分歧。

jushi.english: The ideology has great influence in the world.
jushi.chinese: 这种思想体系在世界上有很大的影响。

jushi.english: There is no fundamental diversity between the two ideologies.
jushi.chinese: 这两种思想意识之间并没有根本的分歧。
